CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 15, 1964, pg. 22, reads: "Stargell and 'MVP' Kids - Seen giving pointers to John Banks (left) or McKeesport and Philip Kiszue of Homewood-Brushton is Wilver Stargell, slugging outfielder of the Pittsburgh Pirates.  The youngsters were honored as the 'Most Valuable Players,' of their sandlot areas, in a pre-game formality at Forbes Field, Tuesday night, in the HYPO contest between the Pirates and Cleveland Indians."
TitMainTitle: American Legion Eger baseball team player John Banks, Pittsburgh Pirates baseball player no. 8 Willie Stargell, and H. B. player Philip Kiszue at Forbes Field for HYPO (Help Young Players Organize) fundraising game between Cleveland Indians and Pittsburgh Pirates
